questions.text: Why didn't Norm ask Cliff what he and Twitchell were talking about?
options: It was none of his business.
He did ask and Cliff wouldn't tell him.
questions.explanation:
Cliff might tell him.

	Cliff and Twitchell were speaking in some sort of "postman's rap". Rebecca asked Norm what they were talking about.

questions.text: Why did Norm fall of the bar stool?
questions.correct: Cliff said he'd buy him a beer.
options: Cliff finally paid back the loan he borrowed from Norm.
questions.explanation:
Cliff said he'd buy him a beer.

	When he got up he said, "I thought Cliff was gonna buy me a beer." Cliff said, "I am" and Norm almost fell off his stool again.

Senior Bartender.

	Woody went in to ask Rebecca for a raise. Sam told him to complement the first thing he saw. The first thing he saw was her rear end so he told her she had a nice smile instead.

Executive Supervising Bartender.

	Sam wanted to prove to Woody that he could get a raise unlike Woody. However, he didn't get a raise either but got his own title.

Managing Director of Waitresses.

	Carla told Woody and Sam they were just bartenders and the titles didn't mean anything. She then went into Rebecca's office and came out announcing her new title.

questions.text: What was Woody doing with the balls?
questions.correct: putting happy faces on all the zeros
options: painting the white balls different colors
questions.explanation:
putting happy faces on all the zeros.

	Rebecca asked him if he was finished numbering the balls. He replied, "almost just putting happy faces on all the zeros". Carla replied, "That's a shocker."

questions.text: What number won the trip to the Caribbean?
questions.explanation:
99 or 66.

	Woody first called number 99. Sam then told him if he turned the ball upside down it looked like number 66. This caused all sorts of problems because Woody announced that the number was 66.

questions.text: Who did Sam say was last year's winner to the Caribbean?
questions.explanation:
Al.

	He said Al was really 24. Al played along and said, "I fell asleep on the beach."

questions.text: What did Sam offer as another first prize?
questions.explanation:
Twidwell painting.

	Sam's plan worked really well because one of the men loved Twidwell and really wanted to own one of his paintings.

questions.text: What number did Woody call for the consolation prize?
questions.explanation:
11.

	Woody then turned the ball upside down and said "Uh oh here we go again." Sam replied, "Woody let me explain something." This is where the show ended but 11 upside down is still 11 so it wouldn't have mattered.
